Geopark Ciletuh-Izu Peninsula Geopark Jalin Kerjasama
07 Nov 2019, 01:10 by Advertorial
SHIZUOKA, (PR).- Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat dan Pemerintah Prefektur Shizuoka, Jepang  menandatangani nota kesepahaman [MoU] kerjasama UNESCO Global Geopark antara Geopark Ciletuh dengan Izu Peninsula Geopark.
Penandatanganan nota kesepahaman dilakukan antara perwakilan Geopark Ciletuh dan Izu Peninsula Geopark disaksikan Gubernur Jabar Ridwan Kamil serta Gubernur Prefektur Shizuoka Heita Kawakatsu juga dihadiri Bupati Sukabumi Marwan Hamami dan Wali Kota Izu Peninsula yang juga Ketua Dewan Promosi Izu Geopark Yutaka Kikuchi di Aula Kantor Pemerintah Prefektur Shizuoka, Jepang, Rabu 6 November 2019. 
Gubernur Jabar Ridwan Kamil yang akrab disapa Emil mengatakan kerjasama antara dua geopark ini cerminan dari dua potensi keindahan Jawa Barat dan Shizuoka yang mewakili Indonesia dan Jepang. “Shizuoka adalah Tengoku [Surga]-nya Jepang dan Jawa Barat adalah Tengoku-nya Indonesia,” tutur Emil.
Menurutnya Jawa Barat dianugerahi potensi keindahan alam mulai dari ratusan air terjun hingga pegunungan hijau aktif yang terus dijaga demi keseimbangan dan dimanfaatkan untuk kesejahteraan masyarakat. “Jadi kerjasama ini diharapkan memberi banyak manfaat,” katanya.
Emil menyatakan Shizuoka bisa membuka peluang dagang dengan Sukabumi karena memiliki potensi hasil bumi yang berlimpah. Di luar itu Jawa Barat juga memiliki potensi kopi yang pernah menyabet penghargaan tingkat dunia serta buah-buah tropis yang diminati warga Jepang. “Hasil bumi ini bisa kami kirim ke Shizuoka,” ujar Emil.
Gubernur juga memaparkan bahwa Jabar memiliki hubungan baik dan panjang dari berbagai sisi dengan Jepang. Dia mencontohkan beberapa industri milik perusahaan besar asal Jepang berdiri dan beroperasi di Jawa Barat, bahkan ada sekolah khusus bagi warga Jepang yang bermukim di Jawa Barat. “Semoga Jawa Barat menjadi rumah yang nyaman bagi warga Jepang,” katanya.
Menurutnya dengan penduduk hampir 50 juta jiwa, pihaknya juga siap mengirimkan anak-anak muda potensial untuk membantu Shizuoka mengembangkan potensi wilayah di masa depan jika dibutuhkan. “Di masa kepemimpinan kami, tentu kami berharap Jawa Barat dan Shizuoka sama-sama maju dan bekerjasama dalam bidang pendidikan, ekonomi, lingkungan dan kebudayaan,” katanya.
Gubernur Prefektur Shizuoka Heita Kawakatsu mengatakan kerjasama pihaknya dengan Pemprov Jawa Barat dilandasi potensi Jawa Barat yang memiliki sejarah dan budaya yang unik juga hubungan antar masyarakatnya yang  kuat. Secara kebetulan, penetapan oleh UNESCO Global Geopark pada Ciletuh dan Izu Peninsula keluar dalam waktu yang sama.
“Kerjasama ini untuk kita menjaga geopark yang sudah masuk dalam naskah UNESCO. Kami senang dengan kerjasama ini. Kerjasama ini agar kedua wilayah bisa bersama-sama makin berkembang,” katanya.
Menurutnya kerjasama ini akan ditindaklanjuti masing-masing pihak untuk mengembangkan kedua geopark juga mendorong potensi ekonomi yang lebih baik. “Lewat kerjasama yang ditandatangani akan berlanjut dengan kunjungan masing-masing daerah, serta bisa berimbas pada peningkatan ekonomi,” katanya.
Dia juga menyinggung kesan khusus kepada Jawa Barat, terutama pada Kopi Jabar. Pihaknya mengaku senang ketika Gubernur Jawa Barat Ridwan Kamil membawakan Kopi Jabar, beserta teh putih dan batik dengan motif rancangan sendiri sebagai souvenir untuk pihaknya.
“Kopi yang Bapak Gubernur Jabar berikan ini adalah kopi terbaik di dunia dan saya ingin memberikan rasa ini ke seluruh penduduk Shizuoka, “ katanya.
Pihaknya berharap ke depan ada penerbangan langsung dari Jawa Barat ke Shizouka untuk makin merekatkan kerjasama dan kunjungan kedua belah pihak.
Bupati Sukabumi Marwan Hamami mengatakan pihaknya mengapresiasi peran Gubernur Jabar Ridwan Kamil dan jajaran Pemprov Jabar yang memfasilitasi kerjasama kedua geopark. Bupati berharap kerjasama ini bisa memberikan dampak positif bagi Geopark Ciletuh.
Dia juga berharap kerjasama saling menguntungkan mampu melahirkan sejumlah peluang-peluang strategis yang bisa memberikan manfaat ekonomi dan kesejahteraan bagi masyarakat. “Kami berharap masyarakat Jepang bisa datang ke Geopark Ciletuh, khususnya warga Prefektur Shizuoka,” tutur Bupati Hamami.***

Geopark Ciletuh-Izu Peninsula Geopark Establishes Cooperation
Nov 7 2019, 01:10 by Advertorial
SHIZUOKA, (PR) .- West Java Provincial Government and Shizuoka Prefectural Government, Japan signed a memorandum of understanding [MoU] on the cooperation of the UNESCO Global Geopark between the Ciletuh Geopark and the Izu Peninsula Geopark.
The memorandum of understanding was signed between representatives of the Ciletuh Geopark and the Izu Peninsula Geopark witnessed by West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil and Shizuoka Prefectural Governor Heita Kawakatsu also attended by Sukabumi Regent Marwan Hamami and Izu Peninsula Mayor who is also the Chairperson of the Izu Geopark Promotion Yutaka Kikuchi in the Shizuoka Prefectural Government Hall, also attended by Sukabumi Regent Marwan Hamami and Izu Peninsula Mayor who is also the Chairperson of the Izu Geopark Promotion Yutaka Kikuchi in the Hall of the Shizuoka Prefectural Government Office, Japan, Wednesday 6 November 2019.
West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil, nicknamed Emil, said the collaboration between the two geoparks is a reflection of the two potential beauty of West Java and Shizuoka, representing Indonesia and Japan. "Shizuoka is Japan's Tengoku [Heaven] and West Java is Indonesia's Tengoku," Emil said.
According to him, West Java was awarded the potential of natural beauty ranging from hundreds of waterfalls to active green mountains that continue to be maintained for the sake of balance and utilized for the welfare of the community. "So this collaboration is expected to provide many benefits," he said.
Emil said Shizuoka could open trade opportunities with Sukabumi because it has abundant agricultural potential. Beyond that, West Java also has the potential for coffee which has won world-class awards and tropical fruits that are of interest to Japanese citizens. "We can send these produce to Shizuoka," Emil said.
The Governor also explained that West Java has good and long relations from various sides with Japan. He gave an example of several industries owned by large companies from Japan established and operating in West Java, there is even a special school for Japanese citizens who live in West Java. "May West Java become a comfortable home for Japanese citizens," he said.
According to him, with a population of nearly 50 million people, his side is also ready to send potential young people to help Shizuoka develop regional potential in the future if needed. "During our leadership, we certainly hope that West Java and Shizuoka will both advance and work together in the fields of education, economics, environment and culture," he said.
Shizuoka Prefecture Governor Heita Kawakatsu said his cooperation with the West Java Provincial Government was based on the potential of West Java which has a unique history and culture as well as strong community relations. Coincidentally, the establishment by the UNESCO Global Geopark on Ciletuh and Izu Peninsula came out at the same time.
"This collaboration is for us to protect the geopark that has been included in the UNESCO text. We are happy with this collaboration. This collaboration is so that the two regions can develop together more, "he said.
According to him, this collaboration will be followed up by each party to develop the two geoparks as well as encourage better economic potential. "Through the cooperation signed will continue with the visit of each region, and can impact on improving the economy," he said.
He also alluded to a special impression of West Java, especially on West Java Coffee. He said he was happy when West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil brought West Java Coffee, along with white tea and batik with their own design motifs as souvenirs for his party.
"The coffee that the Governor of West Java gave is the best coffee in the world and I want to give this flavor to all Shizuoka residents," he said.
He hopes that in the future there will be direct flights from West Java to Shizouka to further strengthen cooperation and visits by both parties.
Sukabumi Regent Marwan Hamami said his party appreciated the role of West Java Governor Ridwan Kamil and West Java Provincial Government ranks who facilitated the cooperation between the two geoparks. The Regent hopes this collaboration can have a positive impact on Ciletuh Geopark.
He also hopes that mutual cooperation can produce a number of strategic opportunities that can provide economic benefits and welfare for the community. "We hope that Japanese people can come to the Ciletuh Geopark, especially residents of Shizuoka Prefecture," said Hamami Regent. ***
